title: Become an Attorney-at-Law
description: The foundational requirement is to be a qualified lawyer. This involves obtaining an LL.B degree, passing the Sri Lanka Law College examinations, and taking oaths as an Attorney-at-Law. This entire process provides the necessary legal knowledge.

title: Gain Experience in a Law Firm's Corporate Department
description: Start your career in the corporate or commercial department of a reputable law firm. This provides intense, hands-on training in handling corporate transactions, drafting commercial agreements, and advising business clients.

title: Transition to an In-House Legal Officer Role
description: Move from a law firm to the legal department of a company. This is the first step to becoming a Legal Advisor. In this 'in-house' role, you provide legal support to one client: your employer. You'll handle day-to-day legal issues, review contracts, and ensure compliance.

title: Legal Advisor / Legal Counsel
description: As you gain seniority, your title may change to Legal Advisor or Legal Counsel. You will be responsible for providing strategic legal advice to business units, managing litigation, and handling more complex legal matters for the company.
qualifications: LL.M in Corporate/Commercial Law (optional but beneficial)
institutes: All major corporations in Sri Lanka

title: Head of Legal / General Counsel
description: Advance to the head of the legal department. In this leadership role, you are the chief legal officer of the company, responsible for all legal affairs, managing the legal team, and advising the CEO and Board of Directors on major legal and regulatory issues.
